mads:mads.mads:note: His Atellanae [CF] 1991: PHI CD ROM #5.3, Latin Canon, bibliographic screen (Mummius)
Smith's Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology, Vol 2, 1867, p. 1220:

Brill's New Pauly: "Mummius, 1, Author of Atellan farces, propably Augustan, ccording to Pomponius Bononiensis and Novius [I 1], who presumably lived about 90 BC, M. revived the atellan farces, which had laid dormant for some time (Macrob. Sat. 1,10,3). His Old Latin metre (use of iambic shortening) and language (abl. testu) suggest that he probably did not write later than the Augustan period...." Blänsdorf, Jürgen (Mainz). "Mummius." Brill's New Pauly. Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and Helmuth Schneider . Brill, 2009.
